msItem.title: Mir'at i Ahmadi.
msItem.note: Folio one, recto: Title in Persian in red, probably by original rubricator and stamp recording presentation by John Romer, as on No 82.. Written by the same scribe as Nos 82 (q.v.) and 84; all three are bound uniformly. Part of the same work as Codrington/Reade No 82, q.v. The second portion, covering events from the accession of Muhammad Shah in A.H. 1131/A.D. 1719 to 1174/1761. Scribe: Shiv La'l son of Sundar La'l Nakir? Gujarati born in Ahmadabad, resident in Surat Written for John Romer. So in colophon. Rubrication as in No 82.
msItem.incipit: Incipit, rubric: Saltanat-i hadrat-i firdaus-aramgah Muhammad Rawshan-akhtar

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
